articles.description: The world is getting warmer, the weather is getting worse. Here's everything you need to know about what humans can do to stop wrecking the planet.

articles.description: If the food you eat changes your health, so does your technological diet. Here's what researchers of digital health need to learn from the study of nutrition.
articles.title: It's Time For a Serious Talk About the Science of Tech "Addiction"

articles.description: Everything you need to know about the tiny flyers that are going to fill the skies, transforming entire industries for the better—and worse.
articles.title: Drones: The Complete Guide
articles.author: David Pierce

articles.description: After a slow and steady expansion across the U.S., social platform Nextdoor is now launching its fourth country outside of its home country. Nextdoor is a sort of tiny Facebook for neighborhoods. It’s a good way to connect with your neighbors, exchange tips, …
articles.title: Nextdoor is expanding to France to connect neighbors
articles.author: Romain Dillet

articles.description: While large companies like Facebook and publishers continue to rethink what their role is in disseminating news these days in the wake of the growing influence of ‘fake news’ and the ever-present spread of misleading clickbait, a London-based startup called F…
articles.title: Factmata closes $1M seed round as it seeks to build an ‘anti fake news’ media platform

articles.title: Ordering Guantánamo to Stay Open Is One Thing, but Refilling It Is Another

articles.description: Legal experts say many were made without fully considering the laws and procedures governing changes, making them vulnerable to legal challenges.

articles.description: Karen Reyes, 29, who is protected by the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, or DACA, teaches deaf toddlers at an Austin, Tex., school. But with the program’s future uncertain, so is hers.
